alert.note: Alert for Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central King and Queen, northwestern Henrico, southeastern Hanover and west central King William Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Glen Allen to near Studley. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Manquin around 400 PM EDT. Hanover and Studley around 405 PM EDT. Aylett around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Enfield, Central Garage, Hanover Airport, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Walkerton, Epworth, Longdale, Solomons Store and Rumford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Hanover; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond); Western King William; Western King and Queen
